channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Home Team Academy dorms ready for trainees again
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

With the resumption of training for full-time police national servicemen, most of the dormitories at the Home Team Academy (HTA) that were converted into support facilities to curb the spread of the coronavirus have been reclaimed for the incoming batch of trainees.

item.title: Swab test generally painless but there might be some discomfort
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

As schools reopen following the circuit breaker measures, the multi-ministry task force has expanded the list of people who will be actively tested for Covid-19 infection to include students aged 13 and up who have acute respiratory infection. Such tests may be done at clinics and polyclinics under the Swab And Send Home programme.

item.title: 2 men charged with operating drones without permit
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Two men were yesterday charged with flying drones without a permit.

item.title: 218 new Covid-19 cases mark lowest daily tally since April 11
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore yesterday reported 218 new coronavirus cases, the lowest daily tally since April 11 when 191 new cases were confirmed.

item.title: 180 lifts under AHTC to be upgraded over 15 months
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Around 180 Housing Board lifts under the Workers' Party-run Aljunied-Hougang Town Council (AHTC) will be upgraded with better safety features over the next 15 months.

item.title: Various factors at play in decisions to lift lockdowns across the world
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Each country has to assess its resources and trade-offs to save both lives and livelihoods.

item.title: This year's Pink Dot event to take place online
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The coronavirus pandemic has claimed another scalp, with this year's Pink Dot SG rally advocating for the LGBTQ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer) community moving online, said the organisers.

item.title: S'pore ranks 4th in safest places to live in during pandemic: Survey
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore is among the safest places to live in during the Covid-19 pandemic, a new study says, indicating that the authorities are well placed to lift restrictions aimed at reducing the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Lotte's Changi Airport stores to be its largest Asia-Pacific operations
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Lotte Duty Free's new liquor and tobacco stores at Changi Airport will be the company's largest operations in the Asia-Pacific, chief executive Kap Lee said yesterday.

item.title: On track to hitting 40k Covid-19 tests a day soon
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Four regional Covid-19 screening centres have started operating and a fifth is set to open soon, taking Singapore's testing capacity from 13,000 tests a day now to 40,000 in the coming months.

item.title: Family of Chinese national who died did not know he had Covid-19
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Every day, foreign worker Wu Liyou would make a video call to Feidong county in China's Anhui province to chat with his family.

item.title: Maid fled couple's abuse by climbing through window
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman slapped and punched her domestic helper who was on her first day of work.

item.title: Latest uni rankings out amid calls for halt due to Covid-19
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Quacquarelli Symonds' list sees NUS stay in 11th place globally while NTU slips to 13th.

item.title: Man who failed to wear mask properly among 3 accused of Covid-19-linked offences
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A 28-year-old man accused of having two knives on him and punching another person while outside his home during the circuit breaker period was charged yesterday with also failing to wear a mask properly.

item.title: Youth arrested over social media posts inciting violence
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A youth suspected of inciting violence and posting comments intending to wound religious feelings on social media was arrested on Monday.

item.title: Vaccine will be made available to all S'poreans who need it
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Every Singaporean who needs it will have access to a Covid-19 vaccine should one become available, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong yesterday.

item.title: 58 businesses, individuals fined in 1st week of reopening
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

In the first week of reopening, 58 fines were issued to businesses and individuals following inspections of workplaces, malls and tourist establishments.

item.title: Jail for ex-actor who trespassed on homes and stole lingerie
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A former part-time actor who had been stealing women's undergarments from homes since 2018 continued doing so during the circuit breaker period and despite being out on bail for the same offence.

item.title: S'poreans' ingenuity, resourcefulness needed in new phase of crisis
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans have shown their grit, adaptability and resilience during the two-month circuit breaker period.

item.title: Nanyang Poly revamps teaching by breaking down subject boundaries
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A polytechnic is introducing changes in its teaching approach that will see students work on projects that involve several subjects and skills from the get-go, similar to what employees in industry have to go through.

item.title: Poll: Q3 hiring outlook weakest since 2009
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The labour market is showing signs of strain as businesses put off recruitment amid the uncertainty brought about by Covid-19.

item.title: Construction sector faces tough transition, but help will be at hand
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The construction sector will need to institute new safeguards at worksites and continue its push for automation and productivity to reduce its reliance on foreign workers in the wake of Covid-19, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Number of dengue cases so far this year crosses 10,000 mark
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Dengue infections this year have surged past the 10,000 mark this week. The 872 cases last week are more than double the 391 cases just five weeks ago.

item.title: Controlling spread of virus by boosting testing, contact tracing
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Aggressive testing and contact tracing will improve Singapore's ability to control the spread of the coronavirus and gradually reopen the economy, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong, noting that the authorities had spent the circuit breaker period boosting their abilities to do both.

item.title: MPA approves 3,000 cases of crew change amid virus curbs
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) has approved almost 3,000 cases of crew change in Singapore since March 27, with three chartered flights set to help more seafarers leave their ships to go home this week.

item.title: Close to 200 clinics able to test for Covid-19
item.description:
June 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Close to 200 clinics are now equipped to perform Covid-19 tests, as part of efforts to ramp up testing as the economy gradually reopens.

item.title: Coronarivus: 58 fines issued to businesses and individuals in first week of post-circuit breaker Phase 1
item.description:
June 10, 2020 12:06 AM

Five businesses were handed $1,000 fines each for failing to enforce proper safe management measures.
